Since this is an existing system, the other major source of test cases
is b=
ug reports.  Write a test to manifest each reported bug before
doing anythi=
ng to fix it.  These will often be of the end-to-end or
integration variety=
 already recommended.  

Besides accumulating a regression suite, this has =
a couple of other
benefits.  First, bugs tend to occur in clusters, so you'=
ll tend to
accumulate the most tests for the most problematic code.    Seco=
nd,
the code that is the most problematic will probably also be the
hardest=
 to test, encouraging refactoring.  Again, focusing on bug
hot-spots tends =
to focus your efforts where they're needed most.

Good hunting,
Lance
